str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
Late, evening. From opse; late; feminine afternoon or nightfall.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Fair weather, good weather. Feminine from eu and the alternate of Zeus; a clear sky, i.e. Fine weather.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be red, fire-colored. From purrhos; to redden.
